pros:
Where to start? This is an incredible place to work. 

The faculty and staff love what they do and when you have that passion all around you, it's infectious. Every day I see my colleagues go well over and above the call of duty to give our students the best possible education experience possible. The icing on the cake is when students come back and tell you that Fleming mad a difference in their lives. Not sure what could be better than that. 

My management also supports me in building relationships with the local university and the rest of the community which is very stimulating intellectually and a good way to stay current. 

Then you put this all in a location that affords a good balance between work and home with lakes and rivers everywhere. Fleming is truly a very special place for students, staff and faculty. If loving what you do is the goal, then I am living the life!
cons: The biggest con is that people have not yet discovered this gem in the heart of the Kawarthas.

review_title: Student technician opportunity allowed me to contribute to meaningful work in the company of incredible people
pros:
I got to assist the Environmental Technician and Technology diploma programs. This included informal tutoring, maintenance, prep, cleanup, and assistance with labs and field camp to help the programs run more smoothly. My work environment was supportive. Students and staff appreciated the work I did. 

The job position allowed me greater opportunity to learn what it takes to facilitate environmental learning opportunities for Frost Campus students. Highlights include working with the (now dismantled) Solar Ecology System and greenhouse during the summer of 2011. This job allowed me the opportunity to be more than just a student within the college system.
cons: The most challenging aspect of working for my program was the limited funding to facilitate the best opportunities possible for ETN and ETY students.

pros: The students are awesome to work with. My Chairperson is wonderful - very supportive; clear in the expectations; fair.
cons: There are significant inequities between how part-time, partial load and full time Professors are treated. Everyone is doing the same job but at widely different salary levels. For instance, if you teach 6.1 - 12 hours/per week, you might earn $125 per hour but if you teach 6 or less hours per week, you will only earn approx. 1/3 of the hrly wage. It feels unfair.

review_title: First-rate employer with great wages and benefits
pros: Great wages and benefits for full time employees.  Lots of room for growth and new challenges.  Management generally responsive.  Most employees are positive and seem to enjoy working here.  Probably one of the best employers in the area.
cons: Many people start part-time or on contract.  Can be difficult to get a foot hold into something full time despite there being lots of postings.

job_title: Muskellunge Hatchery Assistant in Lindsay, ON
pros: Fleming College has amazing staff that can teach you new things all the time while working. I enjoy getting to know the staff while I am also a student. Working for jobs at the college builds your resume and gives you a stronger background when looked at by employees.
cons: Working at Fleming College for two years in a row I have not seen very many cons. The environment is strong and people work together to accomplish things!

job_title: Manual Note Taker in Peterborough, ON
pros: The main positive of this position is helping fellow enrolled students being successful in their programs. An additional positive of this job is earning extra income while getting a college level diploma in the process.
cons: The note taking process takes minimal time away from my studies. It also distracts me from hearing other facts or points to what the professor might say during lectures.

job_title: Customer Service Advisor in Peterborough, ON
pros: A great collective group of hard working individuals that share a common cause to help educate, assist and foster students in a successful way through their studies at Fleming College.
cons: At times our message of help may not always fit with each individual and this occasionally can be trying but ultimately I find we always learn something new with each difficult situation we face.  So in essence, there are not too many cons!
